topics.topic_text: Are you the one who's been raiding the refugee camp at Bitter Springs?
topics.response_text: {Disdainful}Refugee camp? Is that what they're calling it? Good old NCR, they can whitewash anything.
Come for me then.{Intense, half battle cry, half prayer}Flails of God!
{Proud}We were the Flails of God. The scourge of the Mojave, the best warriors and raiders in the Wasteland. Until the NCR tracked us back to Bitter Springs.

topics.topic_text: So you've been hiding in these mountains ever since? Why?
topics.response_text: {Righteous anger}For revenge! The NCR committed an atrocity here, an atrocity that they tried to bury and forget. I'm going to remind them.

topics.topic_text: The people at this camp aren't responsible for your family's death. They're refugees.
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED]{Bitter}I know that. But what else can I do?

topics.topic_text: The Khans settled in Red Rock Canyon years ago. It's time to let go of your hate and join them.
topics.response_text: {Sad, thoughtful}Maybe... maybe you're right. Maybe three years is vengeance enough. Thank you for helping me see that.

topics.topic_text: Take revenge on the people actually responsible: Go attack Camp McCarran.
topics.response_text: {Proud anger}You're right. A Khan's vengeance should be direct and bloody. No more skulking in caves - I'll remind the NCR why they feared us!

topics.topic_text: I promised Captain Gilles I'd stop the attacks on Bitter Springs.
topics.response_text: {Resigned}Then you'll have to kill me. My vengeance will not be stayed.

topics.topic_text: Let's not be hasty. I'll be back.
topics.response_text: {Suspicious}Why should I let you leave? You could lead the NCR right to me. I should kill you now.

topics.topic_text: I understand. I'll leave you to your grief, then.
<Truth> I give you my word I won't tell the NCR where you are. I want to resolve this peacefully.
<Lie> I give you my word I won't tell the NCR where you are. I want to resolve this peacefully.

conversation.response_text: Never forget the Bitter Springs Massacre.

description:
Oscar Velasco is a 35 year-old Hispanic Male.

A lone Great Khan extremist and survivor of the Bitter Springs Massacre, now hiding in a cave north of the Bitter Springs refugee camp. Velasco is consumed by vengeance, targeting NCR personnel and refugees despite their innocence.

Oscar Velasco's Personality: Bitter, vengeful, and single-minded. Velasco is blinded by hatred for the NCR, having lost everything in the massacre. He operates with cold determination, unable to see the irony in his actions of attacking those who have nothing to do with his family's death.

Oscar Velasco's Backstory: Born into the Great Khan tribe, Oscar Velasco lived a nomadic life in the wastelands until his family settled at Bitter Springs. In 2278, during the Bitter Springs Massacre, his family was gunned down by NCR First Recon sharpshooters stationed on Coyote Tail Ridge. Since that day, Velasco has been consumed by vengeance, intensifying his efforts in the past six months as the NCR established a refugee camp at Bitter Springs.
